cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 37 (Thursday, February 29, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. GOTTHEIMER:H.R. 7493.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8The single subject of this legislation is:To provide global humanitarian assistance for emergencyfood, shelter, and basic services to refugees and civilianstrapped in war zones.[Page H773]

item.title: Expressing support for the recognition of October 26, 2023, as "Intersex Awareness Day", and supporting the goals and ideals of Intersex Awareness Day.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

item.title: Making emergency supplemental appropriations for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes.

item.text: Referred to the Committee on Appropriations, and in addition to the Committee on the Budget, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

Referred to the Committee on Appropriations, and in addition to the Committee on the Budget, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

bill.title: Strategic Humanitarian Investments to Ensure Lasting Democracies Act

item.title: Strategic Humanitarian Investments to Ensure Lasting Democracies Act
Strategic Humanitarian Investments to Ensure Lasting Democracies Act

Making emergency supplemental appropriations to the Department of State and the Department of Homeland Security to provide assistance to Israel, Ukraine, and the Indo-Pacific region, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Appropriations, and in addition to the Committee on the Budget, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
